# drawFooterForPage(at:in:)

**Instance Method**

Draws the footer of a page.

## Declaration

```swift
func drawFooterForPage(at pageIndex: Int, in footerRect: CGRect)
```

## Parameters

- **pageIndex**: The index of the page on which to draw the footer content.
- **footerRect**: The rectangle in which to draw the footer content. This rectangle uses the coordinate system of the paper rectangle ([doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintPageRenderer/paperRect]), with the origin of the coordinates at the top-left corner of the sheet.

## Discussion

The default implementation of this method does nothing. The system doesn’t call this method if [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintPageRenderer/footerHeight] isn’t a positive value. Override this method to draw the footer of the specified page.

The system configures this method for drawing to the current graphics context according to [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGraphicsGetCurrentContext()].

## Drawing a page

- **drawPage(at:in:)**: Draws a page of content for the printer.
- **drawHeaderForPage(at:in:)**: Draws the header of a page.
- **drawContentForPage(at:in:)**: Draws the content of a page.
- **drawPrintFormatter(_:forPageAt:)**: Performs custom drawing in addition to the specified print formatter’s drawing for a page.
